name: Whitehead conjecture
rephrased: If a two-dimensional CW complex has a trivial fundamental group (aspherical), then any connected subcomplex is also aspherical (has a trivial fundamental group).
implication_form: If a CW complex is aspherical and two-dimensional, then every connected subcomplex is aspherical.
explained: The Whitehead conjecture, proposed by J. H. C. Whitehead in 1941, is a statement in algebraic topology. It claims that if a CW complex is two-dimensional and aspherical (meaning its universal cover is contractible), then every connected subcomplex of this complex is also aspherical.
